mx:datafield.mx:subfield: The works of C. Memmius L.f. [CF] 1991:
PHI CD ROM #5.3, Latin Canon, bibliographic screen (C. Memmius L.F.)

29. Halbbd., col. 609-616; "Memmius", #8 (C. Memmius; noted by Cicero as L.F. to distinguish him from his relations with the same name; b. ca. 98 B.C.; praetor, 58 B.C.; tribune 66/65 B.C.; propraetorof Bithynia, 57 B.C.; divorced his wife, 55 B.C.; sought consulship 54 B.C.; accused of ambitus and withdrew to Mitylene; returned to Rome 49 B.C.; noted by Cicero as already dead, 46 B.C.)
Malcovati, E. Oratorum romanorum fragmenta liberae rei publicae, 1955:
p. 401 (C. Memmius; tribune, 66 B.C.; aedilis, 63 B.C.; praetor, 58 B.C.; appears to have died before 46 B.C.)
Dict. of Greek and Roman biography and mythology, 1967:
v. 2, p. 1026-1027 (C. Memmius L.F. Gemellus; tribune of the plebs, 66 B.C.; curule aedile, 60 B.C.; sought the consulship, 54 B.C.; impeached for ambitus and withdrew to Mytilene)

p. 555 (Memmius, Gaius; husband of Sulla's daughter Fausta Cornelia; praetor, 58 B.C.; hostile to Caesar; propraetor in Bithynia, 57 B.C.; divorced Fausta and supported Caesar, 55 B.C.; exiled 53 B.C. and returned to Rome 49 B.C.)
